clinical_study.brief_title: Joint Use of Electrocardiogram and Transthoracic Echocardiography in an Observational Study to Monitor Cardio-vascular Events in Patients Diagnosed With COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Joint Use of Electrocardiogram and Transthoracic Echocardiography in an Observational Study to Monitor Cardio-vascular Events in Patients Diagnosed With COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock:
COVID-19 outbreak is often lethal. Morality has been associated with several cardio-vascular
      risk factors such as diabetes, obesity, hypertension and tobacco use. Furthermore, cases of
      myocarditis have been reported with COVID-19.

      Cardio-vascular events have possibly been highly underestimated. The study proposes to
      systematically collect cardio-vascular data to study the incidence of myocarditis and
      coronaropathy events during COVID-19 infection.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of acute myocardial events in COVID-19 population at baseline and during hospital stay
primary_outcome.time_frame: ECG and concomitant troponine at day 1 after admission and twice a week after admission and until patient is discharged, transthoracic echocardiography at day 1 and day 7, t
primary_outcome.description: Viral myocarditis or myocardial infarction or stenosis detected with ST segment elevation or depression associated with troponine elevation and transthoracic echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of cardiovascular outcomes in the cohort
secondary_outcome.description: Cardio-vascular events including but not limited to: myocardial infarction or stenosis, stroke, pulmonary embolism, deep vein thrombosis, ventricular dysfunctio, conduction disorders and sudden death

secondary_outcome.measure: Prognosis role of baseline cardio-vascular caracteristics on patients survival
secondary_outcome.description: Biological biomarkers including but not limited to: baseline troponine T, D-dimers, NT-proBNP, creatinine phosphokinase, creatininemia, ionogram, renine-angiotensin aldosterone system profiling, glycemia (fasting), HbA1c, steroid profiling, lipid profiling

secondary_outcome.measure: Prediction of cardio-vascular events with baseline characteristics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline on first day of admission

secondary_outcome.measure: Characterization of inflammation on cardio-vascular outcomes
secondary_outcome.description: Biological markers including but not limited to: C reactive protein, procalcitonine, fibrinogen, interleukin-6

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with COVID-19 by PCR done on nasal sample.

intervention.description: 12 derivations electrocardiogram done at baseline transthoracic echocardiography

study_pop.textblock:
All patients admitted in Pitié-Salpêtrière hospital will be eligible, if the
        electrocardiogram and the transthoracic echocardiography is technically feasible.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        - COVID-19 positive patients admitted in a ward identified by positive PCR on nasal swab
        samples

        Exclusion Criteria:

        - Patients for which electrocardiogram or transthoracic echocardiography is not technically
        feasible

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Investigations in Clinical Investigation Centers Paris-Est
